verses.verse: I said <S%H559><s%> to myself, <S%H3820><s%> "Come <S%H1980><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> I will test <S%H5254><s%> you with pleasure. <S%H8057><s%> So enjoy <S%H7200><s%> <S%H9185><s%> yourself." And behold, <S%H2009><s%> it too <S%H1571><s%> was futility. <S%H1892><s%>
I said <S%H559><s%> of laughter, <S%H7814><s%> "It is madness, <S%H1984><s%>" and of pleasure, <S%H8057><s%> "What <S%H4100><s%> does it accomplish <S%H6213><s%>?"

I explored <S%H8446><s%> with my mind <S%H3820><s%> [how] to stimulate <S%H4900><s%> my body <S%H1320><s%> with wine <S%H3196><s%> while my mind <S%H3820><s%> was guiding <S%H5090><s%> [me] wisely, <S%H2451><s%> and how to take <S%H270><s%> hold <S%H270><s%> of folly, <S%H5531><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> <S%H834><s%> I could see <S%H7200><s%> what <S%H335><s%> <S%H2088><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> there is for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> heaven <S%H8064><s%> the few <S%H4557><s%> years <S%H3117><s%> of their lives. <S%H9132><s%>
I enlarged <S%H1431><s%> my works: <S%H4639><s%> I built <S%H1129><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%> for myself, I planted <S%H5193><s%> vineyards <S%H3754><s%> for myself;
I made <S%H6213><s%> gardens <S%H1593><s%> and parks <S%H6508><s%> for myself, and I planted <S%H5193><s%> in them all <S%H3605><s%> kinds of fruit <S%H6529><s%> trees; <S%H6086><s%>
I made <S%H6213><s%> ponds <S%H1295><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> for myself from which to irrigate <S%H8248><s%> a forest <S%H9194><s%> of growing <S%H6779><s%> trees. <S%H6086><s%>

I bought <S%H7069><s%> male <S%H5650><s%> and female <S%H8198><s%> slaves, <S%H8198><s%> <S%H5650><s%> and I had <S%H1961><s%> homeborn <S%H1121><s%> <S%H1004><s%> slaves. <S%H1121><s%> Also <S%H1571><s%> I possessed flocks <S%H6629><s%> and herds <S%H1241><s%> larger <S%H7235><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> preceded <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

Also, <S%H1571><s%> I collected <S%H3664><s%> for myself silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold, <S%H2091><s%> and the treasure <S%H5459><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> and provinces. <S%H4082><s%> I provided <S%H6213><s%> for myself male and female singers <S%H7891><s%> and the pleasures <S%H8588><s%> of men <S%H1121><s%> <S%H120><s%> â€“ many <S%H7705><s%> concubines. <S%H7705><s%>

Then I became <S%H1431><s%> great <S%H1431><s%> and increased <S%H3254><s%> more <S%H4480><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> preceded <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> My wisdom <S%H2451><s%> also <S%H637><s%> stood <S%H5975><s%> by me.

And all <S%H3605><s%> that my eyes <S%H5869><s%> desired <S%H7592><s%> I did not refuse <S%H680><s%> them. I did not withhold <S%H4513><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> from any <S%H3605><s%> pleasure, <S%H8057><s%> for my heart <S%H3820><s%> was pleased <S%H8056><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> my labor <S%H5999><s%> and this <S%H2088><s%> was my reward <S%H2506><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> my labor. <S%H5999><s%>

Thus I considered <S%H6437><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my activities <S%H4639><s%> which <S%H7945><s%> my hands <S%H3027><s%> had done <S%H6213><s%> and the labor <S%H5999><s%> which <S%H7945><s%> I had exerted, <S%H6213><s%> and behold <S%H2009><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> was vanity <S%H1892><s%> and striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind <S%H7307><s%> and there <S%H369><s%> was no <S%H369><s%> profit <S%H3504><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

So I turned <S%H6437><s%> to consider <S%H7200><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> madness <S%H1947><s%> and folly, <S%H5531><s%> for what <S%H4100><s%> [will] the man <S%H120><s%> [do] who <S%H7945><s%> will come <S%H935><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> [except] what <S%H834><s%> has already <S%H3528><s%> been done <S%H6213><s%>?
And I saw <S%H7200><s%> that wisdom <S%H2451><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> folly <S%H5531><s%> as light <S%H216><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> darkness. <S%H2822><s%>

The wise <S%H2450><s%> man's eyes <S%H5869><s%> are in his head, <S%H7218><s%> but the fool <S%H3684><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in darkness. <S%H2822><s%> And yet <S%H1571><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that one <S%H259><s%> fate <S%H4745><s%> befalls <S%H7136><s%> them both. <S%H3605><s%>

Then I said <S%H559><s%> to myself, <S%H3820><s%> "As is the fate <S%H4745><s%> of the fool, <S%H3684><s%> it will also <S%H1571><s%> befall <S%H7136><s%> me. Why <S%H4100><s%> then <S%H227><s%> have I been <S%H2449><s%> extremely <S%H3148><s%> wise <S%H2449><s%>?" So I said <S%H1696><s%> to myself, <S%H3820><s%> "This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>"

For there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> lasting <S%H5769><s%> remembrance <S%H2146><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2450><s%> [as] with the fool, <S%H3684><s%> inasmuch <S%H7945><s%> as [in] the coming <S%H935><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> will be forgotten. <S%H7911><s%> And how <S%H349><s%> the wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2450><s%> and the fool <S%H3684><s%> alike <S%H5973><s%> die! <S%H4191><s%>

So I hated <S%H8130><s%> life, <S%H9132><s%> for the work <S%H4639><s%> which <S%H7945><s%> had been done <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> was grievous <S%H7451><s%> to me; because <S%H3588><s%> everything <S%H3605><s%> is futility <S%H1892><s%> and striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>

Thus I hated <S%H8130><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the fruit <S%H5999><s%> of my labor <S%H5999><s%> for which <S%H7945><s%> I had labored <S%H6001><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> for I must leave <S%H5117><s%> it to the man <S%H120><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> will come <S%H1961><s%> after <S%H310><s%> me.

And who <S%H4310><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> whether he will be a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2450><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a fool <S%H5530><s%>? Yet he will have control <S%H7980><s%> over <S%H7980><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the fruit <S%H5999><s%> of my labor <S%H5999><s%> for which <S%H7945><s%> I have labored <S%H5998><s%> by acting <S%H2449><s%> wisely <S%H2449><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

Therefore I completely <S%H5437><s%> <S%H3820><s%> despaired <S%H2976><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the fruit <S%H5999><s%> of my labor <S%H5999><s%> for which <S%H7945><s%> I had labored <S%H5998><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

When <S%H3588><s%> there <S%H3426><s%> is a man <S%H120><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> has labored <S%H5998><s%> with wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%> and skill, <S%H3788><s%> then he gives <S%H5414><s%> his legacy <S%H2506><s%> to one <S%H120><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> has not labored <S%H5998><s%> with them. This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a great <S%H7227><s%> evil. <S%H9567><s%>

For what <S%H4100><s%> does a man <S%H120><s%> get <S%H1933><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> his labor <S%H5999><s%> and in his striving <S%H7475><s%> with which <S%H7945><s%> he labors <S%H6001><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%>?

Because <S%H3588><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> his task <S%H6045><s%> is painful <S%H4341><s%> and grievous; <S%H3708><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> at night <S%H3915><s%> his mind <S%H3820><s%> does not rest. <S%H7901><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

There <S%H369><s%> is nothing <S%H369><s%> better <S%H2896><s%> for a man <S%H120><s%> [than] to eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%> and tell <S%H7200><s%> himself <S%H5315><s%> that his labor <S%H5999><s%> is good. <S%H9185><s%> This <S%H2090><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> I have seen, <S%H7200><s%> that it is from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>
For who <S%H4310><s%> can eat <S%H398><s%> and who <S%H4310><s%> can have <S%H9126><s%> enjoyment <S%H9126><s%> without <S%H2351><s%> <S%H4480><s%> Him?

For to a person <S%H120><s%> who <S%H7945><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%> in His sight <S%H6440><s%> He has given <S%H5414><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> and knowledge <S%H1847><s%> and joy, <S%H8057><s%> while to the sinner <S%H2398><s%> He has given <S%H5414><s%> the task <S%H6045><s%> of gathering <S%H622><s%> and collecting <S%H3664><s%> so that he may give <S%H5414><s%> to one <S%H2896><s%> who <S%H2896><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%> in God's sight. <S%H6440><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> too <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind. <S%H7307><s%>
